content.question: Which of the following is true for a perfectly competitive firm?

choices.label: The firm is a price taker.
The firm chooses its profit-maximizing quantity by equating price to average total cost.
The firm faces a downward-sloping demand curve for its product.
The firmâ€™s short-run supply curve is the same as its average variable cost curve above the minimum of the marginal cost curve.
The firm can expect to earn positive economic profit in long-run equilibrium.

content.answer: The firm is a price taker.
